content:
• Wednesday, August 10, 2016
  • BHC

    Valeant under criminal probe for allegedly defrauding insurers over Philidor

    • Valeant Pharmaceuticals (VRX) -8.5% AH following a Dow Jones report that it is under federal investigation over allegations that it defrauded insurers by hiding its close ties to the Philidor mail-order pharmacy that boosted sales of its drugs.
    • The relationship between VRX and Philidor has been under scrutiny since last October, when questions were raised about VRX's accounting, but Dow Jones says the criminal investigation is based on an unusual legal theory that has not been previously reported.
    • The probe is expected to be the most serious VRX now faces, and could lead to criminal charges against former Philidor executives and VRX as a company, according to the report.
    • Update: Shares are off 9% premarket on Thursday on increased volume.
     
     
     
     
    | 7:15 PM | 356 Comments
  • FENG

    Phoenix New Media loaning $14.8M to promote Yidian app

    • Phoenix New Media (FENG -7.6%) has authorized a new $14.8M loan to Particle, which runs news/lifestyle app Yidian Zixun.
    • Particle will use the proceeds for marketing and to expand the user base of the fast-growing app. Phoenix has a 45.1% stake in Particle and thus in the success of Yidian.
    • Phoenix had authorized loans of up to $20M to Particle in January.
     
     
     
     
    | 6:59 PM
  • BCYP

    Blue Calypso Q2 net loss narrows

    • Blue Calypso (OTCQB:BCYP -2.9%) posted a slightly narrower net loss in Q2 earnings as revenue gains outstripped expenses that rose about 35%.
    • The company lost $0.6M. Revenue rose to $0.5M.
    • Activations rose 110% sequentially. "Should all of our active sales pursuits close in the near term, Blue Calypso would achieve its goal of becoming cash flow positive by fiscal year-end 2016," says CEO Andrew Levi.
    • Cash came to $1M at quarter's end, up from $730K at the end of 2015. It raised $1M in a private placement with Hal Brierley, named chairman of the board late last month.
     
     
     
     
    | 6:35 PM

  • After Hours Gainers / Losers

    • Top gainers, as of 5.25 p.m.: KURA +29.8%. OTC:ANW +16.6%. SPKE +8.4%. PDLI +7.4%. PMTS +6.5%.
    • Top losers, as of 5.25p.m.: AVGR -16.7%. AMRN -10.2%. SHAK -8.8%. OMER -8.7%. COWN -4.3%.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:35 PM
  • AMRN

    Amarin initiates equity offering; shares off 10% after hours

    • Amarin (NASDAQ:AMRN) is down 10% after hours on robust volume in response to its announcement that it has initiated a public offering of American Depositary Shares pursuant to a shelf registration. Price, volume and terms have yet to be released.
    • Update: The company priced its offering of 21M ADSs at $2.85. Closing date is August 16.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:30 PM | 6 Comments
  • CHK

    Chesapeake to exit Barnett Shale, pay $400M to Williams Partners

    • Chesapeake Energy (NYSE:CHK) agrees to sell its interests in the Barnett shale in north Texas - the birthplace of the shale revolution - to Saddle Barnett Resources.
    • CHK says leaving the gas fields will cut shipping and processing costs by $715M by the end of 2017, eliminate ~$1.9B in long-term pipeline agreements, increase operating income through 2019 by $200M-$300M annually, and increase the PV-10 of its proved reserves by ~$550M.
    • As part of the deal, CHK will pay $334M to Williams Partners (NYSE:WPZ) to end their current gathering agreement, projected MVC shortfall payments and fees pertaining to the Barnett Shale assets, with Saddle Resources also expected to pay an unspecified additional sum.
    • CHK also renegotiates its existing cost-of-service gas gathering agreement with WPZ covering the Mid-Continent operating area to a fixed-fee arrangement, which CHK says should reduce its Mid-Continent gas gathering costs by 36%.
    • The Barnett deal includes ~215K net developed and undeveloped acres and ~2,800 operated wells.
    • CHK +5.2% AH, WPZ -0.2%.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:28 PM | 83 Comments
  • KURA

    Kura's lead product candidate shows encouraging results in mid-stage study; shares up 32% after hours

    • Thinly traded nano cap Kura Oncology (NASDAQ:KURA) jumps 32% after hours on increased volume in response to its announcement of positive results from a Phase 2 clinical trial assessing lead product candidate tipifarnib for the treatment of patients with HRAS mutation-positive solid tumors.
    • The study was designed to enroll 22 HRAS-positive cancer patients, 11 in one cohort of thyroid cancers and 11 with non-blood cancers exclusive of thyroid cancer. The primary endpoint is objective response rate (ORR). Per the protocol, two objective responses are required from the first 11 evaluable patients in a cohort in order to expand enrollment by an additional seven participants.
    • 11 evaluable patients have been enrolled in the second cohort, led by salivary gland tumors (n=5) and head and neck squamous cell carcinomas (n=3). In the three patients with HRAS-positive head and neck cancers, two are confirmed partial responders and the other has stable disease, which means that the ORR is 100% [ORR=full responders + partial responders + those with no disease progression (stable)]. The partial responders have been on study for 12 and five months and responded after six and two cycles of treatment, respectively. The patient with stable disease has been so for seven months.
    • No objective responses have been observed in patients with salivary gland tumors, but 60% (n=3/5) have been stable for more than six months.
    • The first cohort of thyroid cancers has not reached its enrollment target.
    • Tipifarnib inhibits an enzyme called farnesyl transferase. Interfering with its function inhibits protein farnesylation, a key signaling process in cancer initiation and development. Farnesyl transferase inhibitors have shown particular promise in blocking HRAS farnesylation.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:21 PM | 3 Comments
  • OMER

    Omeros readies $40M equity offering; shares down 7% after hours

    • Omeros (NASDAQ:OMER) slumps 7% after hours on light volume in response to its announcement that it has initiated a $40M equity offering. Net proceeds will be used for general corporate purposes. Price, volume and terms have yet to be announced.
    • Update: On Thursday, the company announced that it priced the offering at $11.50 per share. Closing date is August 16. Tuesday's close was $13.38.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:43 PM | 9 Comments
  • HCLP

    Hi-Crush Partners to buy frac sand plant in cash and stock deal

    • Hi-Crush Partners (NYSE:HCLP) -2.8% AH after agreeing to acquire Hi-Crush Blair, owner of a raw frac sand processing facility located in Blair, Wis., for $75M in cash and ~7M common units, plus up to $10M of contingent earnout consideration.
    • Blair includes 1,285 acres of Northern White reserves, with a plant processing capacity of 2.86M tons/year of 20/100 frac sand.
    • To help fund the deal, HCLP launches a public offering of 6.5M common units.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:41 PM | 7 Comments
  • NRZ

    New Residential hits the capital raise button

    • The company is selling 20M shares, with underwriter greenshoe for another 3M shares. Proceeds will be used to help fund yesterday's announced $514M in MSR purchases from Walter Investment.
    • NRZ -2.6% after hours to $14.10.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:30 PM | 72 Comments
  • SHAK

    Investor punish Shake Shack for slower pace of comp sales

    • Shake Shack (NYSE:SHAK) slides after showing a slower pace of comparable shack sales growth in Q2.
    • Total sales were up 37% Y/Y to $54.2M in Q2, a slight deceleration from Q1. Same-shack sales were up 4.5%, lower than what investors have come to expect from the established store base.
    • Average weekly sales per U.S.-Shacks were $102K, level with the mark from a year ago.
    • Shack-level operating profit margin came in at  30.8% vs. 30.3% a year ago.
    • Labor costs as a percentage of sales fell back 30 bps to 23.7%. Food and paper costs were down 130 bps to 28.1%.
    • The company increases guidance on 2016 revenue to a range of $253M to $256M.
    • Previously: Shake Shack beats by $0.01, beats on revenue (Aug. 10)
    • SHAK -8.83% AH to $37.26.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:23 PM | 9 Comments
  • SM

    SM Energy upgraded at KeyBanc on Permian positioning

    • SM Energy (SM +1.6%) is upgraded to Overweight from Sector Weight with a $40 price target at KeyBanc, which says SM's Rock Oil acquisition and its prospective ability to accelerate activity across its collective Permian position through future asset sales should drive stronger overall returns and growth across its asset portfolio.
    • KeyBanc believes SM has ~10 years of low-risk Permian inventory, and estimates that more than 50% of SM's capex could be allocated to the Permian in 2017-18, which could drive 15% oil growth in 2017 and 20% in 2018, vs. a respective prior outlook for 2% growth and a 1% decline.
    • SM is planning to sell its non-operated Eagle Ford acreage, which the firm estimates is worth $700M-$800M, which would further de-lever the balance sheet.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:56 PM
  • MDP

    Time Inc. names Klein new general counsel

    • Time Inc. (TIME -2%) has tapped Lauren Ezrol Klein as its executive VP and general counsel.
    • That's effective with the departure of Lon Jacobs, leaving the company Sept. 2. Klein has been senior VP and deputy general counsel.
    • Klein joined Time in 1996 and has worked on most of the company's acquisitions, dispositions and other transactions, including a leading role in the 2014 spin-off from Time Warner.
    • She'll report to Chairman and CEO Joe Ripp.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:53 PM
  • XNET

    Xunlei -2.4% as loss widens from last year

    • Xunlei Limited (NASDAQ:XNET) is 2.4% lower today in U.S. trading after it posted a net loss that again was wider than the previous year, but narrowed compared to last quarter.
    • A net loss from continuing operations of $4.1M compared to a loss of $1.02M a year ago. On a non-GAAP basis, the company lost $2M.
    • Total revenues grew 22.3%; subscription revenues of $22.6M were up 7.5% Y/Y, and online ad revenues jumped 279% to $3.8M. Other Internet value-added services grew 28% to $11.7M.
    • Cash and equivalents came to $391M, down from the prior quarter's $432.1M due to strategic investments and ongoing buybacks.
    • It's guiding to Q3 revenues of $38M-$42M (a 19.4% Y/Y increase at the midpoint).
    • Conference call to come tomorrow at 8 a.m. ET.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:48 PM
  • EGO

    Eldorado Gold upped to Buy at Goldman on growth project opportunities

    • Eldorado Gold (EGO +2.7%) is upgraded to Buy from Neutral with a $5 price target, raised from $4.40, at Goldman Sachs, which says EGO is well positioned to fund its highly prospective organic growth opportunities which should drive adjusted free cash flow improvement of 60% by year-end 2018.
    • Goldman expects the stock to react favorably to updates on important organic growth projects, likely including details about development projects in Greece, which would offer clarity around EGO’s growth pipeline.
    • Noting that EGO’s outlook and the gold market have improved since the company suspended its dividend in early 2016, the firm expects the company to reinstate the dividend by early 2017.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:39 PM | 7 Comments
  • IP

    International Paper holds on to rumor gains

    • International Paper (IP +1.5%) has held on to a good portion of its spike this morning tied to M&A rumors.
    • A snapshot of a Bloomberg terminal post attributes the chatter to Seeking Alpha contributor Quoth the Raven and Twitter handle @OpenOutcrier.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:36 PM | 8 Comments
  • SPWR

    Solar stocks shiver as SunPower cuts guidance, blindsiding investors

    • Analysts are taken aback by SunPower's (SPWR -29.6%) "guidance bomb" which calls for 2016 gross margins of 9.5%-11.5% instead of 13%-15% amid slowing demand for utility-scale solar projects and more competition in the panel market.
    • The surprise is weighing on other stocks in the group: FSLR -7.5%, CSIQ -8.7%, SEDG -9.8%, VSLR -3.1%, JASO -4.5%, SolarCity SCTY -0.9%, SUNE -1.9%, Trina Solar TSL +0.1%.
    • At least six firms slammed the stock with downgrades - J.P. Morgan, Oppenheimer, Deutsche Bank, Janney Capital, Credit Suisse and Avondale.
    • R.W. Baird, who maintained his Outperform rating but slashed his price target to $21 from $37, said during SPWR's earnings conference call that he felt "blindsided... when you guys have publicly spoken over the past near couple of weeks, we didn’t hear any kind of hint of this at all."
    • Credit Suisse’s Patrick Jobin, who cuts his rating to Neutral from Outperform as well as his price target to $12 from $32, says management now faces a credibility problem.
    • Not everyone is negative: BofA/Merrill says SPWR's reduced guidance was a disappointment but the stock remains a Buy due to its technology and efficiency advantages, pipeline and backing from global energy giant Total.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:25 PM | 53 Comments
  • HPT

    Intraday downgrade dings Hospitality Properties Trust

    • FBR Capital's Bryan Maher has no issue with the company's Q2 earnings beat, but after a 22% run higher YTD, the valuation is no longer compelling. He cuts to Market Perform with $32 price target.
    • HPT was at about $31.85 prior to his note, and fell as low as $31.44. It's now at $31.65, down 0.75% on the session.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:20 PM | 4 Comments
  • CLNE

    Clean Energy Fuels +17% on surprise Q2 profit

    • Clean Energy Fuels (CLNE +17.7%) is soaring after reporting a surprise Q2 profit on 24% higher revenue of $108M, which also beat analyst expectations.
    • Q2 revenue included $6.5M of excise tax credits for alternative fuels vs. none in the year-ago quarter, and deliveries of vehicle fuel renewable natural gas and customer station construction activity favorably affected Q2 results.
    • CLNE says it delivered 82.9M gallons in Q2, 11% more than 74.4M gallons delivered in the year-ago quarter.
    • CLNE says "the increasing attention to the immediate favorable environmental impacts of natural gas and particularly our Redeem renewable natural gas, coupled with growing volumes through customer fleet expansions and increased market penetration, are coming through in our operating results."
     
     
     
     
    | 3:08 PM | 6 Comments

  • Technology - Top 5 Gainers / Losers as of 3:00 pm

    • Gainers: HLIT +17%. PXLW +17%. YELP +13%. CBR +6%. JRJC +7%.
    • Losers: SPWR -29%. LUNA -21%. TTGT -12%. XCOM -10%. KLAC -10%.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:00 PM

  • Marchex crushed by weak guidance

    • Marchex MCHX slides after cutting 2016 guidance to adjust for a reduced level of marketing spending by a few large clients.
    • The company expects Q3 call-driven revenue of $30M and Q3 call-driven adjusted EBITDA of -$1M to -$3M. Call-driven revenue of $128M or more is expected for the full year.
    • Shares of Marchex hit a 52-week low of $2.70 earlier.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:00 PM
  • NE

    Noble Corp. cut to Sell at Argus as balance sheet deteriorates

    • Noble Corp. (NE -5.1%) is downgraded to Sell from Hold at Argus on declining offshore drilling activity and balance sheet concerns.
    • Argus says NE has seen little benefit from its fleet of high-spec rigs, as fleet utilization and day rates fell again in Q2, and has been hurt by the early termination of drillship contracts with more possible cancellations still ahead.
    • The firm also notes that NE will now face higher borrowing costs following credit downgrades from S&P and Moody's.
    • The firm cuts its 2016 EPS estimate to $0.20 from $0.61, and widens its 2017 loss estimate to $0.47/share from $0.42.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:28 PM | 23 Comments
  • WMT

    Investors confident in Wal-Mart ahead of earnings week

    • Wal-Mart (WMT +0.6%) cruised to a new all-time high of $74.51 earlier today with sentiment staying favorable after the company rattled the retail e-commerce market with its acquisition of Jet.com.
    • The slowly-evolved rally comes in front of the retailer's Q2 earnings which is due to be released on August 18.
    • What to watch: Wal-Mart's e-commerce growth has slowed in the last four quarters (16% to 10% to 8% to 7%) which has escalated concerns on market share losses to Amazon and Target. Guidance from CEO Doug McMillon and crew on the Jet.com integration and future e-commerce results could reset expectations.
    • There are several articles on Seeking Alpha on the pros and cons of the Jet.com deal.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:19 PM | 12 Comments
  • DIS

    Disney +1.6%; JPMorgan sees good entry point for 'patient investors'

    • Walt Disney (NYSE:DIS) is up 1.6% the day after earnings got a boost from strong results in films as well as parks and resorts (along with a solid opening of its new endeavor in Shanghai), and news of another step into direct-streaming some ESPN content.
    • Macquarie has upgraded its rating on the stock to Outperform, from Neutral, and maintains a $125 price target (implying 27% upside). Pivotal Research, meanwhile, is keeping its Buy rating but trimming its price target, from $122 to $118 (still 20% upside).
    • JPMorgan reiterated its Overweight rating and $118 target, expecting a softer Q4 from the company's studio segment, and noting that subscriber declines were steady in cable (about 2% Y/Y).
    • "While the stock may remain somewhat range-bound near-term given challenging studio comps, escalating sports rights costs over the next few quarters, and ongoing concern over the linear cable universe, we believe patient investors will be well rewarded coming in at current levels," say Alexia Quadrani and team.
    • Regarding catalysts, they're looking to the film slate (Disney has Moana, Doctor Strange and Rogue One: A Star Wars Story coming yet this year), upside from the Netflix deal, and Parks strength.
    • The firm lowered FQ4 EPS estimate to $1.12 from $1.21 (vs. consensus of $1.19) on the aforementioned studio softness as well as consumer products facing tough comps in Frozen.
    • Previously: Disney call: ESPN streaming service; strong Shanghai park launch (Aug. 09 2016)
     
     
     
     
    | 2:17 PM | 17 Comments
  • AXAS

    Abraxas Petroleum -6% on sixth straight losing quarter

    • Abraxas Petroleum (AXAS -6.1%) sinks after posted a surprise Q2 loss - the company's sixth straight losing quarter - and a 42% Y/Y decline in revenues.
    • AXAS says Q2 production of 4,883 boe/day was held down by gas processing curtailments in the Permian and shut-ins and downtime in the Bakken associated with offsetting fracture stimulations.
    • Despite the disappointing Q2 results, AXAS says it plans to complete its well on the Bulls Eye lease and start drilling its well on the Caprito 99 lease this weekend; AXAS also plans to revive its dormant drilling activity in North Dakota.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:13 PM | 1 Comment

  • Energy/Materials - Top 5 Gainers / Losers as of 2:00 pm

    • Gainers: GSV +26%. REN +18%. RTK +16%. THM +15%. MPET +15%.
    • Losers: TDW -23%. RKDA -12%. SDR -10%. PER -9%. NRP -9%.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:02 PM | 3 Comments
  • CEL

    Cellcom +3.7% as lower expenses help triple profits

    • Cellcom Israel (NYSE:CEL) is up 3.7% after posting Q2 net income that more than tripled from a year ago in an environment of lower expenses.
    • Revenue shrank slightly, though. EBITDA rose 10% to 238M shekels (about $62M), beating an expected 219M shekels. EBITDA margin rose to 23.1%.
    • Revenue by segment: Cellular, NIS784M (down 3.2%); Fixed-line, NIS294M (up 4.6%).
    • The cellular subscriber base came to about 2.812M subscribers by quarter's end. TV customer base increased by 12,000 households to bring that total to 87,000.
    • Free cash flow was 103M shekels (about $27M), down 13.4%.
    • Earnings slides
    • Call transcript
     
     
     
     
    | 1:34 PM
  • JONE

    Jones Energy downgraded at Barclays as leverage ratios seen rising

    • Jones Energy (OTC:JONE -7.7%) is downgraded to Underweight from Equal Weight with a $3 price target, cut from $3.50, at Barclays, which believes the company would have to significantly improve its capital efficiency to justify its current premium.
    • Barclays calculates that JONE shares trade at 5.2x the firm's EV/2018 EBITDAX estimate compared with an average of 4.1x for a comparable group of companies.
    • The firm forecasts rising leverage ratios through 2017 as JONE's higher-priced oil and gas hedges roll off.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:57 PM
  • KLAC

    Lam Research, KLA-Tencor extend merger timeline, shares negative

    • The deal was originally announced last October and has faced multiple hold-ups from the U.S. Department of Justice and regulatory agencies in Korea, Japan and China in the process.
    • KLA-Tencor (KLAC -8.7%) and Lam Research (LRCX -4.1%) are trading on high volume at 3.81M vs. an average of 970,370 and 3.63M vs. an average of 2.16M, respectively.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:51 PM

  • Midday Gainers /Losers

    • Gainers: DXPE +47%. WAC +26%. CLNE +19%. GSV +18%. HWAY +20%. RTK +18%. HCKT +16%. PXLW +15%. YELP +14%. HLIT +14%.
    • Losers: NYMX -43%. MYGN -34%. SPWR -31%. WGBS -25%. OA -21%. TDW -20%. MCHX -19%. APEI -19%. LUNA -18%. OTC:ECTE -16%.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:47 PM

  • Stocks turn lower alongside crude oil

    • WTI crude has slid 1.8% to $42 per barrel following an unexpected rise in oil inventories reported by the EIA this morning. The move has helped drag down the energy sector, with Exxon Mobil's 1.2% decline the worst in the Dow 30.
    • The S&P 500 is lower by 0.25%, the Nasdaq by 0.4%, and the Dow by 0.15%.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:37 PM | 5 Comments
  • OA

    Orbital ATK to restate financials, miss filing deadline

    • Orbital ATK (OA -20.4%) plunges after saying it will miss the filing deadline for its most recent quarter and restate more than a year of results due to accounting issues.
    • OA says it had failed to meet cost-cutting targets at an ammunition plant it manages for the Army in Missouri that left it with up to $450M in losses rather than breaking even on the fixed-price contract won in 2012.
    • OA says it does not believe there was any fraud involved, CEO David Thompson said in a conference call after the company reported better than expected Q2 earnings but lowering full-year revenue guidance.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:18 PM | 4 Comments

  • Consumer Goods - Top Gainers / Losers as of 12:00 pm

    • Gainers: RL +11%. THST +10%. COKE +8%. FIZZ +7%.
    • Losers: SPU -9%. MPAA -9%. FLO -8%.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:04 PM
  • DNR

    Denbury Resources downgraded at Barclays as balance sheet still stretched

    • Denbury Resources (DNR -5.8%) is downgraded to Underweight from Equal Weight with a $2.50 price target, cut from $3, at Barclays on valuation, as shares have gained 40% YTD.
    • Barclays believes DNR's balance sheet still appears stretched even after the company has reduced its debt by 16% since year-end 2015 through $443M in debt exchanges and $97M in open market purchases.
    • The firm expects shares to respond favorably to further oil price gains given the ~95% oil-weighted production mix, but thinks DNR’s asset base requires a higher oil price threshold and longer lead time to drive volume growth compared to some peers.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:57 AM | 3 Comments
  • SCOR

    ComScore names new CEO, CFO; delays quarterly filing amid probe

    • ComScore (NASDAQ:SCOR) is up 5.2% after replacing its CEO and key management, amid a lengthy investigation into its accounting practices.
    • Co-founder Gian Fulgoni is becoming chief executive officer, replacing Serge Matta, who will remain as executive vice chairman and an adviser to Fulgoni.
    • Chief Revenue Officer David Chemerow has been named the new chief financial officer, replacing Melvin Wesley III, who "has discontinued his role as such" and will aid with the transition.
    • President Bill Livek (formerly CEO of Rentrak, now merged with comScore) will take strategic and day-to-day responsibility for expanding the TV, cross-platform and movies measurement businesses.
    • Joan Lewis was named non-executive chair of the comScore board. She joined the board in 2015.
    • In an SEC filing, the company noted that its 10-Q for the quarter would be filed late -- part of a cascade of delays that built up earlier this year.
    • ComScore says its investigation is "substantially complete" and that it's identified "areas of potential concern." The company began looking into results that may have been boosted by nonmonetary revenue (including from barter agreements).
     
     
     
     
    | 11:45 AM
  • AMBC

    Ambac down 4% post-earnings; investors await catalysts

    • Q2 operating earnings of $115M or $2.54 per share vs. $218.1M and $4.82 in Q1.
    • Adjusted book value per share of $29.94 rose from $29.10. Current price is $18.49.
    • The insured portfolio was reduced by $7B, or 7%, to $94B. Adversely classified credits cut by $1B, or 5.4%, to $18B.
    • Actions on expenses during quarter will save $5M annually, representing 9% of total compensation expense.
    • Also announced is a $60M settlement (not related to rep & warranty) with a RMBS counterparty.
    • Buybacks: 228.5K warrants for $1.61M, leaving warrants outstanding at 4.2M; $7.4M in surplus notes along with $9.6M of accrued and unpaid interest on previously called surplus notes.
    • Reiterating a Neutral rating on the stock, BTIG's Mark Palmer applauds management for creating value through "various self-help actions," while waiting for positive catalysts like the restructuring of Puerto Rico's debt, a settlement of the Bank of America rep & warranty case, and an agreement with holders of surplus notes and deferred payment obligations.
    • AMBC -4%
     
     
     
     
    | 11:21 AM | 1 Comment
  • OA

    Cowen throws in the towel on Orbital

    • Cowen downgrades Orbital ATK (NYSE:OA) to Market Perform from Outperform following the company's Q2 results.
    • The stock nosedived in early trade and is now down over 20%.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:16 AM
  • FSIC-OLD

    FS Investment higher alongside gain in earnings and book value

    • Q2 adjusted net investment income of $0.24 per share vs. $0.21 earned in Q1, $0.35 one year ago. Distributions of $0.22275.
    • Net realized loss on investments of $0.03 per share and unrealized appreciation of $0.37.
    • Purchases of $389.8M vs. sales and repayments of $413M, leaving net proceeds of $23.2M, which were mostly used to pay down debt.
    • Net asset value of $9.18 per share vs. $8.82 three months earlier. Current price is $9.57.
    • Previously: FS Investment misses by $0.02, beats on total investment income (Aug. 9)
    • FSIC-OLD +1.5%
     
     
     
     
    | 11:08 AM
  • COKE

    Coca-Cola Bottling flies after earnings

    • Coca-Cola Bottling (NASDAQ:COKE) jumps 12% after the company reports Q2 results.
    • Unit case volume was up 2% for the sparkling category during the quarter and 11% for still on a comparable basis.
    • Shares of Coca-Cola Bottling crossed over $160 for the first time since May earlier today.
    • Previously: Coca-Cola Bottling reports Q2 results (Aug. 9)
     
     
     
     
    | 11:05 AM
  • GARS

    Garrison Capital lower as book value slips further

    • Q2 net investment income of $5.8M or $0.36 per share vs. $5.9M and $0.36 in Q1. Dividend is $0.35.
    • Net decrease in net assets from operations of $3.9M or $0.24 per share vs. decrease of $2.7M and $0.17 in Q1.
    • Net asset value per share of $12.94 slips from $13.50 three months earlier. Current price is $10.35.
    • $1.5M of buybacks in Q2 after $3.1M in Q1. $10M buyback program was put in place in Oct. 2015.
    • Previously: Garrison Capital misses by $0.01, misses on total investment income (Aug. 9)
    • GARS -1.5%
     
     
     
     
    | 11:01 AM

  • Healthcare - Top 5 Gainers / Losers as of 11:00 am

    • Gainers: HWAY +20%. OPGN +15%. ZIOP +11%. PEN +8%. HRTX +7%.
    • Losers: WGBS -24%. NYMX -16%. SPPI -16%. HTBX -15%. CGIX -12%.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:00 AM | 2 Comments
  • CYBR

    CyberArk -6%; Goldman Sachs comments

  • RIG

    Transocean rig probe begins as diesel leak worries grow

    • British authorities have launched a probe into how a Transocean (RIG -2.3%) oil rig ran aground in Scotland on Monday, with 280 metric tons of diesel aboard, after rough weather caused the rig to disconnect from a tugboat.
    • A team of salvage experts has been airlifted onto the stricken rig amid severe weather that is hampering the operation.
    • While the risk of pollution from the incident is considered low, there are growing environmental concerns after a thin sheen of diesel appeared on waters in a nearby cove and plants on the beach were covered in a black substance, indicating a possible leak from the 1983-built rig.

  • VTVT

    Recent IPO vTv Therapeutics reports positive trial data for diabetes candidate TTP399; shares up 3%

    • North Carolina-based biopharma outfit vTv Therapeutics (VTVT +3.1%) announces positive top-line results from a Phase 2b study assessing liver-selective glucokinase activator TTP399 for the treatment of type 2 diabetes. The trial achieved its primary endpoint of a statistically valid reduction from baseline in HbA1c at day 168.
    • Patients received a daily oral dose of 800 mg of TTP399. The reduction in HbA1c was dose-dependent and sustained throughout the study period.
    • Data analysis is ongoing. Full results will be submitted for publication.
    • Glucokinase (GK) is a key regulator of glucose levels. According to the company, TTP399 only activates GK in the liver thereby avoiding disruption in the interaction between GK and glucokinase regulatory protein (GKRP) which can lead to hypoglycemia, limited durability of response and other side effects, problems that have dogged other GK activators.
    • In an earlier Phase 2 study, 86% of T2D patients with HbA1c levels of 7.5% or less who received daily doses of 800 mg of TTP399 for six weeks achieved normal blood glucose levels (HbA1c no higher than 6.5%).
     
     
     
     
    | 10:31 AM
  • TEAM

    Atlassian -2%; downgraded at BTIG Research

    • Atlassian (TEAM -2.3%) has been taken down to a Neutral rating at BTIG Research on what the firm attributes to valuation concern.
    • Shares presently trade at 10.7 times EV/FY17 revenue.
    • BTIG Research analyst Joel Fishbein believes even if the company can post 43% Y/Y revenue growth (FY 2016 result) in FY 2017, the stock would still be trading at a 10x multiple. He additionally notes Atlassian possesses a solid business model capable of producing robust revenue growth with sizable margins. Fishbein considers the company's FY 2017 revenue guidance of around 30% growth too conservative and forecasts the company generating higher growth in coming years.
    • He further comments: "With the market appropriately anticipating a continuation of the "beat and raise" trend, we'd look for a pull-back in shares as the next potential buying opportunity."
    • Atlassian is currently trading down around 2%, though has been volatile in early trading, at one point falling more than 5%. It is up more than 10% on a 1-month basis and more than 37% on a 3-month basis.

  • LLY

    Lilly's late-stage study of breast cancer candidate abemaciclib falls short of interim efficacy criteria, study to continue as planned, final data expected in H1 2017; shares off 3% premarket

    • Based on a pre-planned interim analysis by the independent Data Monitoring Committee, Eli Lilly's (NYSE:LLY) Phase 3 study, MONARCH-2, assessing abemaciclib plus fulvestrant in women with HR+, HER2- breast cancer will continue as planned since interim efficacy criteria were not met. Final data are expected in H1 2017. The primary endpoint is progression-free survival (PFS) versus placebo + fulvestrant up to ~31 months.
    • The company has five MONARCH trials in process evaluating abemaciclib in breast cancer, four assessing combination regimens. Phase 2 MONARCH-1 assessed abemaciclib as monotherapy in treatment-resistant breast cancer patients.
    • Breakthrough Therapy-tagged abemaciclib is a cell cycle inhibitor that is designed to block the growth of cancer cells by inhibiting the enzymes CDK4 and CDK6.
    • Shares are off 3% premarket on light volume.
     
     
     
     
    | 8:13 AM | 6 Comments
